name: U.S. Web Design System (USWDS)
description: USWDS is a design system for the federal government. We make it easier to build accessible, mobile-friendly government websites.

components.name: Accordion
components.definition: An accordion is a list of headers that hide or reveal additional content when selected.

concepts.name: bordered
concepts.description: Display a border around accordion content.

components.name: Alert
components.definition: An alert keeps users informed of important and sometimes time-sensitive changes.

concepts.name: info
concepts.description: Display an informational status alert.

concepts.name: warning
concepts.description: Display an warning status alert.

concepts.name: error
concepts.description: Display an error status alert.

concepts.name: success
concepts.description: Display an success status alert.

concepts.name: slim
concepts.description: Display a slimmer version of the alert.

concepts.name: no-icon
concepts.description: Display an alert without an icon.

components.name: Banner
components.definition: Banners identify official websites of government organizations in the United States. They also help visitors understand whether a website is official and secure.

components.name: Breadcrumb
components.definition: Breadcrumbs provide secondary navigation to help users understand where they are in a website.

concepts.name: wrap
concepts.description: Wrap the breadcrumb bar instead of truncating.

components.name: Button
components.definition: A button draws attention to important actions with a large selectable surface.

concepts.name: secondary
concepts.description: Button uses secondary color.

concepts.name: accent-cool
concepts.description: Button uses accent-cool color.

concepts.name: accent-warm
concepts.description: Button uses accent-warm color.

concepts.name: base
concepts.description: Button uses base color.

concepts.name: outline
concepts.description: Transparent button with a color stroke.

concepts.name: inverse
concepts.description: Light color button for dark backgrounds.

concepts.name: big
concepts.description: A bigger button.

concepts.name: unstyled
concepts.description: A button that looks like a link.

components.name: Button group
components.definition: A button group collects similar or related actions.

concepts.name: default
concepts.description: The default button group arranges each button as a separate element with a gap between them. On mobile devices, the buttons are arranged vertically.

concepts.name: segmented
concepts.description: Segmented button groups display a set of discrete buttons in a row as a single element.

components.name: Card
components.definition: Cards contain content and actions about a single subject.

concepts.name: flag
concepts.description: Display in a horizontal (“flag”) orientation at a specified width.

concepts.name: header-first
concepts.description: Displays the header element before the media element.

concepts.name: media-right
concepts.description: In combination with `flag`, sets the media element on the right. (Flag cards display media on the left by default.)

concepts.name: media-inset
concepts.description: Indents the media element so it doesn’t extend to the edge of the card.

concepts.name: body-exdent
concepts.description: Extends the body element out over the card border. Useful for light-bordered cards.

concepts.name: footer-exdent
concepts.description: Extends the footer element out over the card border. Useful for light-bordered cards.

concepts.name: header-exdent
concepts.description: Extends the header element out over the card border. Useful for light-bordered cards.

concepts.name: media-exdent
concepts.description: Extends the media element out over the card border. Useful for light-bordered cards.

components.name: Character count
components.definition: Character count helps users know how much text they can enter when there is a limit on the number of characters.

concepts.name: character-count
concepts.description: Character count helps users know how much text they can enter when there is a limit on the number of characters.

components.name: Checkbox
components.definition: Checkboxes allow users to select one or more options from a list.

components.name: Collection
components.definition: A collection displays a compact list of multiple related items like articles or events. The list links each item to its original source.

concepts.name: condensed
concepts.description: A more condensed item presentation with less space between items.

components.name: Combo box
components.definition: A combo box helps users select an item from a large list of options.

components.name: Date picker
components.definition: A date picker helps users select a single date.

components.name: Date range picker
components.definition: A date range picker helps users select a range between two dates.

concepts.name: range
concepts.description: A date range picker helps users select a range between two dates.

components.name: File input
components.definition: File input allows users to attach one or multiple files.

components.name: Footer
components.definition: A footer serves site visitors who arrive at the bottom of a page without finding what they want.

concepts.name: big
concepts.description: A multi-column footer that expands and collapses on mobile.

concepts.name: slim
concepts.description: A compact version of the footer.

components.name: Form
components.definition: A form allows users to enter information into a page.

components.name: Layout Grid
components.definition: Use our flexible grid system to structure website content. The grid is mobile-first, powered by flexbox, and based on a 12-column system.

components.name: Header
components.definition: A header helps users identify where they are and provides a quick, organized way to reach the main sections of a website.

concepts.name: basic
concepts.description: Display a simple header.

concepts.name: megamenu
concepts.description: Display a megamenu.

concepts.name: extended
concepts.description: Display an extended header.

components.name: Icon
components.definition: Icons help communicate meaning, actions, status, or feedback.

concepts.name: size-3
concepts.description: 3 unit x 3 unit icon.

concepts.name: size-4
concepts.description: 4 unit x 4 unit icon.

concepts.name: size-5
concepts.description: 5 unit x 5 unit icon.

concepts.name: size-6
concepts.description: 6 unit x 6 unit icon.

concepts.name: size-7
concepts.description: 7 unit x 7 unit icon.

concepts.name: size-8
concepts.description: 8 unit x 8 unit icon.

concepts.name: size-9
concepts.description: 9 unit x 9 unit icon.

components.name: Icon list
components.definition: An icon list reinforces the meaning and visibility of individual list items with a leading icon.

components.name: Identifier
components.definition: The identifier communicates a site’s parent agency and displays agency links required by federal laws and policies.

components.name: In-page navigation
components.definition: The in-page navigation allows navigation to specific sections on a lengthy content page.

components.name: Input mask
components.definition: An input mask is a string expression that constrains input to support valid input values.

components.name: Language selector
components.definition: The consistent placement, interface, and behavior of the language selection component allows users to easily find and access content in the language the user is most comfortable in.

components.name: Link
components.definition: A link connects users to a different page or further information.

concepts.name: external
concepts.description: Display an external link icon after the link.

components.name: List
components.definition: A list organizes information into discrete sequential sections.

components.name: Memorable date
components.definition: A select for month followed by two text fields is the easiest way for users to enter most dates.

components.name: Modal
components.definition: A modal disables page content and focuses the user’s attention on a single task or message.

concepts.name: lg
concepts.description: Larger window and larger heading size on wider screens.

components.name: Pagination
components.definition: Pagination is navigation for paginated content.

components.name: Process list
components.definition: A process list displays the steps or stages of important instructions or processes.

components.name: prose
components.definition: Format a block of running text.

components.name: Radio buttons
components.definition: Radio buttons allow users to select exactly one choice from a group.

concepts.name: tile
concepts.description: Input tiles provide a larger interaction area and neatly group the label with the form control for readability. They’re useful in application forms and questionnaires, but may not be recommended when they create clutter on the page.

components.name: Range slider
components.definition: A range slider allows users to choose an approximate number from a range.

components.name: Search
components.definition: Search allows users to search for specific content if they know what search terms to use or can’t find desired content in the main navigation

concepts.name: big
concepts.description: Search component with increased padding and font-size.

concepts.name: small
concepts.description: A compact variation of the search. Uses a magnifying glass icon for the submit button.

components.name: Select
components.definition: A select component allows users to choose one option from a temporary modal menu.

components.name: Side navigation
components.definition: Hierarchical, vertical navigation to place at the side of a page.

components.name: Site alert
components.definition: A site alert communicates urgent sitewide information.

concepts.name: info
concepts.description: Displays an information site alert.

concepts.name: emergency
concepts.description: Displays an emergency site alert.

concepts.name: slim
concepts.description: Display a slimmer version of the site alert.

concepts.name: no-icon
concepts.description: Display an site alert without an icon.

components.name: Step indicator
components.definition: A step indicator updates users on their progress through a multi-step process.

concepts.name: no-labels
concepts.description: Don’t show step labels.

concepts.name: counters
concepts.description: Show step counters.

concepts.name: counters-sm
concepts.description: Show small step counters

concepts.name: center
concepts.description: Center counters and labels in each step.

components.name: Summary box
components.definition: A summary box highlights key information from a longer page or displays next steps.

components.name: Table
components.definition: A table shows information in columns and rows.

concepts.name: borderless
concepts.description: Removes the outer table borders, retaining only a single bottom border on each row. Best for tables with more text than numbers.

concepts.name: compact
concepts.description: Reduces the row height and vertical spacing to display more table rows within a limited space. Should only be used with dense, numerical data, not text content. Pairs well with scrollable and striped variants, but is not suitable for use with stacked variants.

concepts.name: scrollable
concepts.description: Apply a horizontal scrollbar if the columns exceed the available width. Ideal for dense tables with many columns.

concepts.name: stacked
concepts.description: Stacks the table cells on narrow screens. Ideal for tables that contain more text information than numerical data. If you use this variant, you must ensure there is a data-label attribute on each cell of the table that matches the column header.

concepts.name: stacked-header
concepts.description: Stacks the table cells on narrow screens and visually promotes the first cell of every row into a “header” for that group. Preferred for directories and other lists where the first cell of every row is a name. If you use this variant, you must ensure there is a data-label attribute on each cell of the table that matches the column header.

concepts.name: striped
concepts.description: Applies alternating horizontal striping to help the eye track across table rows. Pairs well with the scrollable variant for tables with many columns.

components.name: Tag
components.definition: A tag draws attention to new or categorized content elements.

concepts.name: big
concepts.description: A tag with increased padding and font size.

components.name: Text Input
components.definition: A text input allows users to enter any combination of letters, numbers, or symbols. Text input boxes can span single or multiple lines.

concepts.name: error
concepts.description: The error state of the text input.

concepts.name: success
concepts.description: The success state of the text input.

concepts.name: 2xs
concepts.description: Displays an input at a specific width.

concepts.name: xs
concepts.description: Displays an input at a specific width.

concepts.name: sm
concepts.description: Displays an input at a specific width.

concepts.name: md
concepts.description: Displays an input at a specific width.

concepts.name: lg
concepts.description: Displays an input at a specific width.

concepts.name: xl
concepts.description: Displays an input at a specific width.

concepts.name: 2xl
concepts.description: Displays an input at a specific width.

components.name: Time picker
components.definition: A time picker helps users select a specific time.

components.name: Tooltip
components.definition: A tooltip is a short descriptive message that appears when a user hovers or focuses on an element.

components.name: Validation
components.definition: Stating validation requirements up front, with live feedback, means users won’t be left guessing.
